  • Classes in us.springett.threatmodeling.model used by us.springett.threatmodeling
    Class
    Description
    ThreatModel
    The root level object for a threat model and/or threat modeling exercise.
  • Classes in us.springett.threatmodeling.model used by us.springett.threatmodeling.model
    Class
    Description
    Asset
    The system must have something that the attacker is interested in; these items/areas of interest are defined as assets.
    CAPEC
    An enum of all classified CAPECs.
    CWE
    An enum of all classified CWEs.
    DataFlow
    The dataflow between two assets.
    EntryPoint
    Entry points define the interfaces through which potential attackers can interact with the application or system to supply it with data.
    ExternalDependency
    External dependencies are items external to the application of system being threat modeled that may still pose a threat.
    Risk
     
    Stride
    The Stride threat classification system developed by Microsoft and later implemented by many organizations.
    Threat
    A theoretical event with the potential to adversely impact an asset through unauthorized access, destruction, disclosure, modification of data, and/or denial of service.
    ThreatClassification
    A system for categorizing threats.
    ThreatModel
    The root level object for a threat model and/or threat modeling exercise.
    ThreatState
    The current state of the Threat mapped to the Microsoft TAM tool.
    TrustLevel
    Trust levels represent the access rights that the application will grant to external entities.
